title: On Exams with the Isabelle Proof Assistant. (arXiv:2303.05866v1 [cs.LO])
abstract: We present an approach for testing student learning outcomes in a course on automated reasoning using the Isabelle proof assistant. The approach allows us to test both general understanding of formal proofs in various logical proof systems and understanding of proofs in the higher-order logic of Isabelle/HOL in particular. The use of Isabelle enables almost automatic grading of large parts of the exam. We explain our approach through a number of example problems, and explain why we believe that each of the kinds of problems we have selected are adequate measures of our intended learning outcomes. Finally, we discuss our experiences using the approach for the exam of a course on automated reasoning and suggest potential future work.
